summary: The VetPAC Act of 2025 proposes to establish the Veterans Health Administration Policy Advisory Commission (Commission). This Commission, comprised of 17 members appointed by the Comptroller General, will review operations at the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) and submit reports and recommendations to Congress. The review will encompass various aspects of VHA operations, including IT infrastructure, access and wait times, quality of care, workforce issues, patient satisfaction, and budgetary outlook. The Commission is granted powers to hire staff, conduct research, and collect data, with the goal of improving healthcare delivery to veterans.
